newsitem.title: FRANCE: One injured in clash in National Front town.
newsitem.headline: One injured in clash in National Front town.

text.p: An aide to the National Front mayor of the southern French town of Vitrolles was injured and taken to hospital after a clash with anti-racist militants on Friday, an FN spokesman said.
Police said they had to intervene on Vitrolles' open-air market when a brawl broke out between members of the extreme-rightist party and militants of the "Ras le Front" (Enough of the Front).
The two sides came to blows and sprayed tear gas at each other while distributing leaflets ahead of Sunday's first round of France's parliamentary election, police said.
Police were not immediately able to confirm the injury.

The rightists included Bruno Megret, deputy party head, whose wife Catherine was elected mayor of Vitolles this year, making it the fourth town in France to elect a mayor from Jean-Marie Le Pen's anti-immigrant party.
